case_vignette:
A 5-year-old female presents with a plaque on her left leg. The lesion appeared a few months after her birth. It has been increasing in size proportionally to her growth. The parents mentions that the skin lesion sometimes becomes irritated, erythematous and itchy when the patient plays with it or when she gets sick. Physical exam reveals a red-brown well delimited plaque on her left leg without any noticeable erythema or epidermal changes. The patient is otherwise healthy and has no other symptoms. The parents are concerned about the possibility of a skin cancer. The doctor orders a biopsy to rule out skin cancer and other possible causes.

## Step 3: Rewrite the text with the replaced references.

Physical exam reveals a red-brown well delimited plaque on his left leg without any noticeable erythema or epidermal changes. The patient is otherwise healthy and has no other symptoms. I have a skin lesion on my left leg that sometimes becomes irritated, red, and itchy, especially when I play with it or when I get sick.

Final Diagnosis: Congenital melanocytic nevus
